article_title: Three weapons North Carolina needs in AIDS fight
article_text:
In North Carolina, an estimated 36,300 people are living with HIV

In 2013 alone, 1,525 people were diagnosed with HIV in our state

All of these North Carolinians live in a region – the American South – with the highest rates of new HIV diagnoses, the largest percentage of people living with the disease and the most people dying from it
